availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Trimble County, Kentucky, merchant and farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Lucy H. Shirley Garriott in Oldham County, Kentucky, on October 10, 1837. Father of W. V. Garriott, Frances E. Garriott, Elisabeth M. Garriott, Joseph A. Garriott, Thomas Garriott, John Garriott, and Nancy Garriott. Merchant in Trimble County in 1850. Farmer in Trimble County in 1860. Owned seven enslaved persons in Trimble County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trimble County, District 1, p. 405A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trimble County, p. 16.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Trimble County, p. 2.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Pendleton County Marriages, Film #000482445, p. 226.
